results.title: Raku - English style
results.creator_credit: Castle Hill Brenchley, John Anderson and Robert Fournier
results.brief_description: A group of English potters demonstrate how Raku pottery is made, glazed and fired. The commentator clearly explains how the kiln is made while the potters construct one and use it.

results.title: Rak
results.brief_description:
A elderly woman of Russian origin is informed that she is stricken with cancer (‘rak’ in Russian). She is determined to fight the disease and live. She must also fight the inertia and indifference of the medical staff and of the administrative system supposed to look after her. In the light of her experiences, her son David decides to care for her at home and do everything possible to make her last days the happiest.

Credits: Director, Charles Belmont ; writers, Charles Belmont ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Andre Hodeir.
Cast: Sami Frey, Lila Kedrova, Anne Deleuze, Maurice Garrel, Philippe Leotard.

results.title: Rajput glory
results.creator_credit: D R D Productions, Film Group of India and R Bacha
results.brief_description: Shows the magnificent architectural wonders of Rajasthan (Jaipur) and, in this courtly setting, the “ghoomar” dances performed by the women of Rajasthan.

results.title: Rajneesh: Spiritual Terrorist
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Connop and Vision Quest Films
results.brief_description: From all over the world thousands of affluent and educated seekers flock to the Rajneesh’s ashram in Poona, India. We gain access to the Rajneesh and to the exotic private and public lifestyles that have earned him headlines around the world. The documentary also provides intimate portraits of some of the disciples around Rajneesh, including a young American actor, a former CIA agent, a German princess, a young Australian and Rajneesh’s personal dentist.

results.title: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'
results.brief_description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation. Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.

results.title: Raising Victor Vargas
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal, Alain de la Mata, Peter Sollett, Robin O'hara and Scott Macaulay
results.brief_description: Victor (Victor Rasuk) a New York City teenager gets caught trying to sleep with ‘Fat Donna’ when his younger sister Vicki (Krystal Rodriguez) realises what he’s up to and spreads the word in the neighbourhood. Victor, thinking his reputation has suffered a blow, quells the summer heat with a visit to the local public pool with his best friend Harold. Here he meets ‘Juicy Judy’ (Judy Marte) and he decides to pursue her. Living in a small apartment with his strict Grandmother, sister and piano-playing younger brother Nino (Rasuk’s real-life brother Silvestre), Victor finds life as a teenager challenging when he gets the blame for having a bad influence on his siblings. Coming-of-age is tough (and sometimes comical) for Victor as he finds real love, gets a glimpse of what manhood is about and asserts his place within the family. Based on the short film “Five Feet High and Rising” by its writer/director Peter Sollett. Cast also includes Kevin Rivera, Altagracia Guzman, Melonie Diaz.

results.title: Raising the standard
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide, British Productivity Council and John Spencer
results.brief_description: Discusses the British standard of living and relates it to productivity and ways in which both may be improved. Reorganising of work is essential, and problems involved are shown. The most important of these is the attitude and, not infrequently, the opposition of workers. There is a greater need for tactful handling of problems on the part of management. Labor must realise that more work, which leads to increased productivity, means higher standard of living and not simply higher profits and dividends. The film concludes with a discussion on these points.

results.title: Raising Arizona
results.creator_credit: Ethan Coen, Circle Films, Ted Pedas, Jim Pedas, Ben Barenholtz and Joel Coen
results.brief_description: A pacy black comedy about a quirky couple who resort to kidnapping when nature fails to give them a baby. Hi (Nicholas Cage) and Edwina (Holly Hunter) decide to kidnap one of the famous Arizona quintuplets and in doing so trigger a wild chase across the country. Co-starring John Goodman and William Forsythe.

results.title: Raise the red lantern
results.creator_credit: Fu-Sheng Chiu, Era International, China Film and Zhang Yimou
results.brief_description: On the death of her father Songlian is forced to leave her University studies and becomes the fourth concubine to a rich man. She enters a world in which a rigid ancestral code dictates the day to day existence of the four wives. Every night a red lantern is raised outside the boudoir of the wife who will be “graced” with the husband’s sexual favours. The women, though equally unhappy, are further divided by the competition to give birth to a son. The beautiful palatial house in which the women are enclosed slowly loses its allure as the closed, hermetic world in which the women exist is revealed as a physical and emotional prison. The ravishing cinematography and set design is itself a symbolic commentary on the abuses of power involved in the maintenance of “ancestral privilege”. As the seasons pass Songlian is stripped of her humanity, dignity and her power. Based on the novel “Wives and Concubines” by Su Tong. Gong Li stars as Songlian. This film was perceived as an attack on the Chinese establishment and banned although elsewhere, it was widely acclaimed and earned an Oscar nomination for Best Foreign Film. Winner of the Silver Lion at Venice Film Festival, 1992. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
